other_tests.changes_over_time: B. microti DNA was detected at the conclusion of the 6-week ATV/AZ treatment. PCR was negative at 60 and 102 days after initiation of the four-drug regimen.

other_tests.findings: Positive for intra-erythrocytic inclusions consistent with Babesia and parasitemia of 0.3%.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient had a total of 4 negative follow-up blood smears after the initial treatment, but showed increasing parasitemia (up to 1%) upon relapse.

other_tests.findings: Emergence of point mutations in the cytb and rpl4 genes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Wild-type cytb and rpl4 were observed at diagnosis, but resistance haplotypes were noted after the initial treatment course.
